text: The human body contains enough phosphorus to make 2,200 match heads.
A supernova can briefly outshine an entire galaxy.
Bananas are curved because they grow towards the sun.
The average iceberg weighs 20 million tons.
A hummingbird's heart beats up to 1,200 times per minute.
The loudest sound ever recorded was the 1883 Krakatoa eruption.
Pineapples take 2-3 years to grow.
The human body generates about 3.8 million joules of energy daily.
A blue whale's aorta is large enough for a human to crawl through.
Diamond planets exist where the surface is covered in diamonds.
The human stomach gets a new lining every 3-4 days.
A cat's purr vibrates at a frequency that can heal bones.
The coldest place in the universe is the Boomerang Nebula.
Humans share 70% of their DNA with slugs.
A giant squid's eyes are the size of dinner plates.
The Sun is 400 times bigger than the Moon but also 400 times farther away.
The human brain uses about 20% of the body's oxygen.
A single strand of hair can support 3 ounces of weight.
Neutron stars can spin at 716 rotations per second.
The human eye can detect a candle flame from 30 miles away.
A flea can jump 150 times its body length.
The observable universe contains about 2 trillion galaxies.
The human nose can detect 1 trillion different scents.
A cockroach can live for a week without its head.
Light from the Sun takes 8 minutes to reach Earth.
The human body contains enough fat to make 7 bars of soap.
A mantis shrimp can punch with the force of a bullet.
The Sun converts 4 million tons of matter to energy every second.
The human brain can store 2.5 petabytes of data.
A bee's wings beat 200 times per second.
Jupiter's Great Red Spot could fit 3 Earths inside.
The human heart pumps about 2,000 gallons of blood per day.
An octopus can squeeze through any hole larger than its beak.

The human brain generates about 70,000 thoughts per day.
A spider can produce 7 different types of silk.
Venus is the hottest planet despite Mercury being closer to the Sun.
The human eye processes 36,000 pieces of information per hour.
A honey bee visits 50-1000 flowers in one trip.
Mars has the largest volcano in the solar system.

A chameleon's tongue can be twice the length of its body.

The human liver performs over 500 different functions.
A woodpecker's tongue wraps around its skull.
Neptune's winds can reach 1,200 mph.
The human body produces about 25 million new cells per second.
A dragonfly can see in almost all directions at once.
Pluto is smaller than Russia.
The human skeleton is completely replaced every 10 years.
A salmon can jump 12 feet into the air.
The Moon is drifting away at 3.8 cm per year.
The human body contains about 0.2 milligrams of gold.
A firefly's light is the most efficient in the world.
The Sun makes up 99.86% of the mass of the solar system.
The human brain is 73% water.
A dolphin sleeps with one eye open.
A day on Mercury is longer than its year.
The human lungs contain 300 million alveoli.
A starfish can regenerate its whole body from one arm.
The largest known star is 1,700 times the size of the Sun.
The human body makes about 200 billion red blood cells daily.
A garden snail has about 14,000 teeth.
One teaspoon of a neutron star weighs 6 billion tons.
The human ear can distinguish over 400,000 sounds.
A cheetah's acceleration is faster than most sports cars.
Black holes can evaporate over time due to Hawking radiation.
The human body contains enough carbon for 900 pencils.
A housefly can taste with its feet.
The Milky Way is on a collision course with Andromeda.
The human tongue is the strongest muscle relative to size.
A crocodile cannot stick out its tongue.
There are more stars than grains of sand on all Earth's beaches.
The human body has over 600 muscles.
A pelican's bill can hold 3 gallons of water.
The fastest pulsar spins 716 times per second.
The human intestines are about 25 feet long.
A blue-ringed octopus has enough venom to kill 26 adults.
A photon of light has no mass.
The human skin weighs about 8 pounds on average.
A tarantula can live for 30 years.
The speed of light is 299,792,458 meters per second.
The human body has about 5 liters of blood.
An elephant's trunk has 40,000 muscles.
Gravity travels at the speed of light.
The human heart beats about 3 billion times in a lifetime.
A giraffe's tongue is about 20 inches long.

The human body has about 100,000 miles of blood vessels.
A lobster's blood is colorless until exposed to oxygen.
Time moves slower in stronger gravitational fields.
The human body loses about 4 kg of skin cells per year.
A praying mantis has 5 eyes.
Electrons can be in two places at once.
The human stomach produces a new lining every 3-4 days.
A hummingbird's brain is 4.2% of its body weight.
Quantum entanglement allows instant communication between particles.
The human body contains about 37.2 trillion cells.
A pistol shrimp's snap can produce light.
The uncertainty principle limits what we can know about particles.
